channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road is disintegrating and you have to avoid, 31st October
item.description:
Where water is always there the road surface is disintegrating. It means people are trying to avoid it and get close to causing accidents. Please do not close this report. Please repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole was fixed today. HOWEVER all the rubble from the pothole was left in the gutter. Please can it be removed before it blocks the drain at the bottom of the road causing a flooding issue. Thank you, 31st October
item.description:
Outside no. 6 Hamilton St
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Hamilton Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 31st October
item.description:
Email received 31/10/2024 - copy attached, along with photos. Customer reports a yew tree at the location which has grown beyond its boundary, with branches overhanging the public walkway. Additionally, the berries from the tree regularly drop onto the pathway, creating a slippery surface. Compounding the issue, the walkway is also covered in moss, further increasing the risk of slips and falls.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement slippery and unsafe, 31st October
item.description:
Previously reported and issue closed without satisfactory resolution. Pavement between telephone exchange and 12 Bells is slippery and unsafe due to build of mud and silt from overflowing drain. Highways attended and swept with a broom but mechanical sweeper required for a deep clean. Itâ€™s currently unsafe to use the pavement on a busy section of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 31st October
item.description:
Hi Alexander Further to our telephone conversation earlier today I can tell you what 3 words for approximate location of the sunken manhole are gifts.later.rewarding Please could you advise as why this manhole and subsequent drainage should cause such vibrations to my house, 16 Conway Drive that.submit.forks on what3 words Many Thanks Wayne O'kelly
